intro: Curculigo conoc, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Hyacinthaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the base of the plant. Curculigo conoc is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its distinctive appearance.
